content.text: One January day in Munich, the temperature at noon was \(3^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
Write down the difference between these two temperatures
Write down all the numbers displayed on your calculator
Write your answer to part (a) correct to 3 decimal places
Pedro and Eva do their homework
Pedro takes 84 minutes to do his homework
The ratio Pedro's time : Eva's time \(= 7:6\)
Work out the number of minutes Eva takes to do her homework
Use the information in the diagram to find the value of \(a\)
Do not use a calculator and show all the steps of your working
The line \(MN\) is the locus of points inside the square which are
Shade the region inside the square containing points which are
nearer to \(AB\) than to \(BC\) and nearer to \(A\) than to \(B\)
\(M\) is the midpoint of \(AB\) and \(N\) is the midpoint of \(CD\)
An equilateral triangle has sides of length \(16.1 \mathrm{cm}\), correct to the nearest millimetre
Find the lower and upper bounds of the perimeter of the triangle
A student is chosen at random
What is the probability that the student likes rugby and football?
On the Venn diagram shade the region \(R^{\prime}\cap F^{\prime}\)
11 students are asked if they like rugby \((R)\) and if they like football \((F)\)
The Venn diagram shows the results
Martina changed 200 Swiss francs (CHF) into euros (€)
Give your answer correct to the nearest euro
Bruce invested \(420 at a rate of 4\%\) per year compound interest
Calculate the **total** amount Bruce has after 2 years
Give your answer correct to 2 decimal places
A sphere has a volume of \(80 \mathrm{cm}^3\)
Calculate the radius of the sphere
[The volume, \(V,\) of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\) .]
A water pipe has a circular cross section of radius 0.75 cm
Water flows through the pipe at a rate of \(16\mathrm{cm / s}\)
Calculate the time taken for 1 litre of water to flow through the pipe
Find the equation of the line passing through the points (0, \(-1\)) and (3, 5)
\(t\) varies inversely as the square root of \(u\)
Find, in terms of \(\mathbf{p}\) and \(\mathbf{r}\), in its simplest form,
When \(\overrightarrow{PT} = - \frac{1}{2}\mathbf{p} + \mathbf{r}\) , what can you write down about the position of \(T\)?
\(OPQR\) is a parallelogram, with \(O\) the origin
\(OM\) and \(RQ\) are extended to meet at \(S\)
The diagram shows a sector of a circle of radius \(12\mathrm{cm}\) with an angle of \(135^{\circ}\)
Calculate the perimeter of the sector
Write as a single fraction in its simplest form
The diagram shows a triangular prism of length \(12\mathrm{cm}\)
Triangle \(ABC\) is a cross section of the prism
Calculate the angle between the line \(CE\) and the base \(ABED\)
Calculate the deceleration of the car
Calculate the distance travelled during the 30 seconds
The diagram shows the speed-time graph of a car
It travels at \(28 \text{m/s}\) for 20 seconds and then decelerates until it stops after a further 10 seconds
The diagram shows a solid prism of length \(15\mathrm{cm}\)
The cross section of the prism is the trapezium \(ABCD.\)
Calculate the **total** surface area of the prism
